p: Compound 1, with a pseudomolecular ion at m/ z 191.0555 (C 7H 12O 6), was identified as quinic acid. It yielded fragment ions at m/ z 171 ([M-H-H 2O] −), 127.04 ([M–H-CO 2-H 2O] −) and 109 ([M–H-CO 2-2H 2O] −) [ 28]. Compound 3, with pseudomolecular ion at m/ z 271.0453 (C 12H 16O 7), was identified as arbutin; it yielded a fragment ion at m/ z 108 for [M-H-162] − due to loss of the hexose moiety [ 40].
